Answer: It is not about offsetting natural emissions. Those are already offset by natural absorptions. They are part of the natural carbon cycle, and they have kept the CO2 level fairly stable for thousands of years.It is about not adding more CO2 to the carbon cycle. In particular, it is about stopping the burning of fossil fuels.It is not about offsetting natural emissions. Those are already offset by natural absorptions. Answer: Grammatical mistakes can be easy to make. But fear not! Our team at Grammarly has compiled a handy list of common grammatical errors to help make your writing accurate, clear, and professional.Ambiguous (“Squinting”) modifiersA squinting modifier is a misplaced modifier that, because of its location in a sentence, could modify either the phrase that precedes it or the one that follows it. In the example sentence, is the subject listening to music slowly or slowly gettGrammatical mistakes can be easy to make. But fear not! Our team at Grammarly has compiled a handy list of common grammatical errors to help make your writing accurate, clear, and professional.Ambiguous (“Squinting”) modifiersA squinting modifier is a misplaced modifier that, because of its location in a sentence, could modify either the phrase that precedes it or the one that follows it. In the example sentence, is the subject listening to music slowly or slowly getting a headache? To correct a squinting modifier, move its position in the sentence to clarify to the reader which word you intend to modify.Misuse of lie/layIf you plan to place or put an object somewhere, such as a plate on a table, you should use “lay.” If you intend to stretch out on a bed for a nap, you should use “lie.” The verb “lie” is an intransitive verb, which means it does not need an object. The transitive verb “lay” requires an object.It may take some getting used to this “lay” or “lie” business; after all, misuse of these verbs is common. But if you remember to lay down your fork before you’re full, then you won’t have to lie down later from overeating.Comma splicesHe was very hungry, so he ate a whole pizza.To splice means to connect or join. When a writer joins two independent sentences with a comma instead of separating them with a period or coordinating conjunction, that’s a comma splice.The comma has its jobs to do, but connecting two independent sentences isn’t one of them. Besides, the period gets testy when his sister, the comma, steals his thunder. Periods have their jobs, and so do commas, but never the twain shall meet—unless it’s in the form of a semicolon. Semicolons can also take the place of a coordinating conjunction, such as “and,” “but,” or “so,” among others.Run-on sentencesRun-on sentences, also known as fused sentences, occur when two complete sentences are squashed together without using a coordinating conjunction or proper punctuation, such as a period or a semicolon. Run-on sentences can be short or long. A long sentence isn’t necessarily a run-on sentence.To avoid run-on sentences, see if there is more than one idea communicated by two or more independent clauses. In our examples, there are two complete sentences:Example:Example:Both sentences are complete ideas by themselves; therefore, use a semicolon or a period to indicate that they are separate independent clauses.Using “could of” instead of “could have”“Could have” is always correct; “could of” never is. Writers probably make this grammar gaffe because, when we speak, the contraction “could’ve” sounds an awful lot like “could of.”TautologiesTautologies express the same thing twice with different words. In our example, the word “made” implies that Jack used his own two hands to create the pail. The prepositional phrase “with his own hands” creates a redundancy. Once you know what they are, it’s fun to discover tautologies: dilapidated ruins, close proximity, added bonus, large crowd...The list goes on and on!After reading through this list of common grammatical mistakes, you might be wondering how to remember all these rules as you write. Answer: Nice idea!!! It's already in use. People use documents to store in blockchain. The documents that are of worty involving value. E.g., will document, lease document, property inheritance document, agreement document, etc. It can be used in any Industry. But generally it's not advisable to keep documents in blockchain as it is unnecessary. In the sense large docs add up space and every node on blockchain has to download all the documents which increases cost. So in general scenario, documents are generally kept in what are called IPFS. You can learn more about in https://ipfs.ioHere the documentNice idea!!! It's already in use. People use documents to store in blockchain. The documents that are of worty involving value. E.g., will document, lease document, property inheritance document, agreement document, etc. It can be used in any Industry. But generally it's not advisable to keep documents in blockchain as it is unnecessary. In the sense large docs add up space and every node on blockchain has to download all the documents which increases cost. So in general scenario, documents are generally kept in what are called IPFS. You can learn more about in https://ipfs.ioHere the documents are kept and their hashes are taken and stored in blockchain. The hash stays in blockchain as it is immutable. It is enough to check by taking the hash of the document at any time in future to compare it with the first hash created while initial upload of the document. This will ensure that the document is immutable and it also speeds the network as the documents are kept out of blockchain.

Answer: We have that technology. It’s called a Cesarean section. Once, it inevitably killed the mother, now it’s safe and reliable.However, it’s not considered the optimal way to give birth, even though it’s safe and reliable and pain-free (at the time, recovery is a bitch). It’s because there is a reason for vaginal child birth.During the baby’s passage through the birth canal, it’s exposed to flora that it would not otherwise be, and it helps to make the baby more healthy than in a c-section. If you could do a “Beam it out” style birth, this would still be a factor.In reality, childbirth is often moWe have that technology. It’s called a Cesarean section. Once, it inevitably killed the mother, now it’s safe and reliable.However, it’s not considered the optimal way to give birth, even though it’s safe and reliable and pain-free (at the time, recovery is a bitch). It’s because there is a reason for vaginal child birth.During the baby’s passage through the birth canal, it’s exposed to flora that it would not otherwise be, and it helps to make the baby more healthy than in a c-section. If you could do a “Beam it out” style birth, this would still be a factor.In reality, childbirth is often more painful than it needs to be, because of hospital systems and our expectations. We assume that it’s normal to go to bed to give birth while hooked up to monitors and most women labour on their backs. From experience, lying on your back in labour is extremely painful, while staying upright was much easier.Women who have given birth in a hospital setting, labouring in bed, and at home or in a birthing centre, say the one where they were free to move or position themselves as they wanted was far less painful.Rather than looking at a technology which will reduce the pain of childbirth in the future, maybe we should be looking at techniques which will do that now.

The idea was great, but the execution and development weren’t.Intel recently revealed its smart glass called Vaunt. Vaunt looks a lot like a regular set of glasses at first glance and they are nearly indistinguishable from regular glasses and they only weigh about 50 grams.At its core, Vaunt is simply a system for displaying a small heads-up style display in your peripheral vision. It is designed to show very simple basic information in one of your eye. It can showYou might be heard about the Google glass which featured a bulky camera on one side and a rather odd chunk of display at the side. The idea was great, but the execution and development weren’t.Intel recently revealed its smart glass called Vaunt. Vaunt looks a lot like a regular set of glasses at first glance and they are nearly indistinguishable from regular glasses and they only weigh about 50 grams.At its core, Vaunt is simply a system for displaying a small heads-up style display in your peripheral vision. It is designed to show very simple basic information in one of your eye. It can show you simple messages like directions or notifications. It works over Bluetooth with either an Android phone or an iPhone much in the same way your smartwatch does, taking commands from an app that runs in the background to control it. If there is any notification it can be read or dismissed using certain head gestures.It has little red monochrome projector. that shines an image on the holographic mirror which bounces it directly into the eyeball.Notification can only be seen if you are look down at the display. It does interfere with the standard line of vision.This was the technology which every college kids dreamt and now Intel has finally built it.﻿Thankyou

Then, when you were ready, you’d say your goodbyes, and be given a sedative to put you to sleep, then a pain-free drug would stop your breathing.Your final days would be spent celebrating your life, not prolonging your death. And your family would find solace in the fact that this was your decision. This is how you wanteEuthanasia tourism.Instead of a long, downward, expensive spiral into death from chronic illness, companies will provide vacations to places that allow assisted suicide.You and your loved ones will fly to the place and spend however much quality time you’d like to spend there. Then, when you were ready, you’d say your goodbyes, and be given a sedative to put you to sleep, then a pain-free drug would stop your breathing.Your final days would be spent celebrating your life, not prolonging your death. And your family would find solace in the fact that this was your decision. This is how you wanted to go out.The site would have everything your loved ones would need post-mortem:A chapel or other area for religious services.A mortician.A crematorium. (It’s easier to transport ashes back home.)Lawyers for will and testament reasons.The entire package would be all-inclusive. Once everything was done, your family would fly home, full of happy memories of your final days on Earth.Does this sound crazy? Think about this: Have you ever lost a loved one to a long-term chronic illness? Have you ever seen someone you love, on life support for an extended amount of time, with no hope of recovery? Do you know someone whose final weeks on Earth were spent racking up expensive medical bills for their loved ones to deal with after their death?When you really think about it, this idea is genius. It’s the best option for all involved.It can’t be automated.It can’t be outsourced.If I had the money, I’d open one of these as soon as possible.If YOU have the money and open one, at least give me a little credit please.

From 5G and the Internet of Things to the blockchain, new technology trends are creating a digital transformation for businesses worldwide.Here are some of the latest trends in technology and businesses for 2022 and beyond.#1. 5G Network and the Internet of Things (IoT)The 5G network is the next generation of mobile communication. 5G will take one millisecond to respond to commands, whereas 4G can take up to 200 milliseconds.The 5G network will benefit businesses that rely on IoT (physical thiBusinesses and Technology: 4 Top Technology Trends for 2022Technology is changing and businesses too. From 5G and the Internet of Things to the blockchain, new technology trends are creating a digital transformation for businesses worldwide.Here are some of the latest trends in technology and businesses for 2022 and beyond.#1. 5G Network and the Internet of Things (IoT)The 5G network is the next generation of mobile communication. 5G will take one millisecond to respond to commands, whereas 4G can take up to 200 milliseconds.The 5G network will benefit businesses that rely on IoT (physical things connected to the internet). Self-driving vehicles, for example, rely heavily on IoT devices to navigate roadways and traffic.Many businesses are now using IoT devices to build and maintain smarter buildings that utilize connected HVAC infrastructure and automated door locks, thermostats, smoke detectors, and more.Green Benefits - Carbon FootprintInvesting in the 5G network and expanding the use of IoT in business will also help to reduce businesses' carbon footprint. The reputation of a business depends on how a business reduces the harm to the environment and the climate.#2. Artificial IntelligenceAI is already a part of our lives. We use everyday smartphones and their applications, including artificial intelligence software such as Apple’s Siri and Google Assistant.With AI, your smartphone can be used to measure distances and to simulate the way that a piece of furniture will look in your living room. Voice and object recognition are two features of AI that are now common in tablets and smartphones.Artificial Intelligence is also being adopted by businesses to cut costs, and to help automate processes. Industries that can expect to see an increasing amount of AI support include:MarketingAI is used to get data from online users or your target audience. By capturing a user’s online behavior, including search and browsing history, AI can determine which online ads will be most relevant for your target audience.eCommerceAI in the world of eCommerce and online shopping has many benefits, including online chatbots, intelligent product recommendations, and sophisticated inventory management.SalesAI helps sales teams to improve forecasting, predict market trends, and improve customer communications. Advanced CRM software can help you to identify customers that are most likely to convert.Research and DevelopmentHow AI can collect and analyze data and information is beyond human capability. AI machines can use in research and development within the healthcare, automotive, web development, and financial industries.
